categories.name: Autism Spectrum Disorder
categories.description: Evidence-based strategies for supporting students with autism spectrum disorder

methods.name: Visual Supports
methods.description: Use of visual aids to support understanding and communication
techniques: Visual task analysis for multi-step activities
methods.when_to_use: Throughout the day, especially during transitions and new activities

methods.name: Social Stories
methods.description: Short narratives describing social situations and appropriate responses
techniques: Create personalized stories for specific situations
methods.when_to_use: Before new situations, to address social challenges, during calm moments

methods.name: Structured Routines
methods.description: Consistent, predictable classroom routines and procedures
methods.when_to_use: Implemented consistently throughout the school day

methods.name: Sensory Accommodations
methods.description: Environmental and tool-based supports for sensory needs
methods.when_to_use: Based on individual sensory profile and as preventive measure

methods.name: Special Interest Integration
methods.description: Incorporating student's passionate interests into learning
techniques: Use interests in examples and problems
Build relationships through shared interest discussions
methods.when_to_use: To increase engagement and motivation

categories.name: Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder
categories.description: Strategies for supporting students with ADHD

methods.name: Movement Integration
methods.description: Incorporating physical movement into learning activities
methods.when_to_use: Proactively scheduled throughout instruction

methods.name: Task Chunking
methods.description: Breaking larger tasks into smaller, manageable pieces
methods.when_to_use: For any multi-step or lengthy assignment

methods.name: Visual Timers
methods.description: Using timers to help with time awareness and task completion
techniques: Time Timer showing elapsed/remaining time visually
Work periods with visible time limits
methods.when_to_use: During work periods, transitions, and timed activities

methods.name: Frequent Feedback
methods.description: Providing immediate and regular positive reinforcement
methods.when_to_use: Continuously during instruction and work time

methods.name: Fidget Tools
methods.description: Allowing appropriate movement tools during instruction
methods.when_to_use: During seated instruction and independent work

categories.name: Learning Disabilities
categories.description: Strategies for students with dyslexia, dyscalculia, and other learning disabilities

methods.name: Multi-Sensory Instruction
methods.description: Engaging multiple senses simultaneously in learning
techniques: Combining visual, auditory, and kinesthetic learning
methods.when_to_use: During initial instruction and remediation

methods.name: Graphic Organizers
methods.description: Visual frameworks for organizing information and thinking
methods.when_to_use: Before, during, and after learning new content

methods.name: Assistive Technology
methods.description: Technology tools to support learning challenges
methods.when_to_use: Based on individual needs and IEP specifications

methods.name: Extended Time
methods.description: Providing additional time for task completion
techniques: Time-and-a-half or double time on tests
Separate testing location to reduce time pressure
methods.when_to_use: For reading-heavy tasks, tests, and complex assignments

categories.name: Sensory Processing Disorder
categories.description: Strategies for students with sensory processing challenges

methods.name: Sensory Diet
methods.description: Planned sensory activities throughout the day
methods.when_to_use: Proactively scheduled, often with OT input

methods.name: Environmental Modifications
methods.description: Adapting the physical environment to reduce sensory challenges
methods.when_to_use: As preventive environmental setup

methods.name: Self-Regulation Strategies
methods.description: Teaching students to recognize and manage their sensory needs
methods.when_to_use: Taught proactively, used as needed

methods.name: Sensory Tools
methods.description: Providing access to appropriate sensory tools
methods.when_to_use: Based on occupational therapy recommendations

categories.name: Emotional and Behavioral Disorders
categories.description: Strategies for students with emotional and behavioral challenges

methods.name: Positive Behavior Support
methods.description: Proactive, positive approach to behavior management
techniques: 4:1 ratio of positive to corrective feedback
methods.when_to_use: Consistently throughout the school day

methods.name: Relationship Building
methods.description: Intentionally developing positive relationships with students
techniques: 2x10 strategy (2 minutes personal conversation for 10 days)
Show genuine interest in their lives
methods.when_to_use: Ongoing, especially important at start of year/placement

methods.name: De-escalation Strategies
methods.description: Techniques for preventing and reducing behavioral escalation
methods.when_to_use: At first signs of agitation, before crisis

methods.name: Cool-Down Space
methods.description: Designated area for students to regain composure
methods.when_to_use: When student needs to regulate before continuing

methods.name: Coping Skills Instruction
methods.description: Explicitly teaching emotional regulation strategies
methods.when_to_use: Taught during calm times, prompted when needed

general_strategies.name: Universal Design for Learning
general_strategies.description: Flexible approaches that accommodate all learners
key_principles: Multiple means of action and expression

general_strategies.name: Explicit Instruction
general_strategies.description: Clear, direct teaching of skills and concepts

general_strategies.name: Positive Classroom Environment
general_strategies.description: Creating a supportive, inclusive classroom culture
